intro: Eschscholzia glyptosperma, commonly known as the narrowleaf poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and delicate, showy flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant produces capsule-like fruits that contain numerous small, flat seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, open habitats. Eschscholzia glyptosperma is part of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known species like the common poppy.
